opportunities.title: VitaDAO Longevity Research Funding
opportunities.description: Community-funded longevity research. $9M+ raised. Token holders vote on projects. Funded 'too speculative' Alzheimer's research that traditional funders rejected. Pfizer Ventures invested $4.1M.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Crypto-funded DAO. Scientists can pitch directly to token holders. No traditional grant committees.

opportunities.title: UK ARIA Precision Neurotechnologies Program
opportunities.description: UK's DARPA equivalent. Recently funded Motif Neurotech for therapeutic BCIs. Program director Jacques Carolan actively seeking transformative neurotech. American researchers CAN participate as collaborators.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Foreign government funding for US researchers. Less competitive than US equivalents. UK wants international collaboration.

opportunities.title: Bridge Funding for Disrupted Neurodegenerative Research
opportunities.description: EMERGENCY FUND for researchers who lost NIH/federal funding in 2025-2026 cuts. Joint program with Alzheimer's Association. Specifically targets disrupted research.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Bridge funding for defunded researchers. Fast turnaround. Less bureaucracy than federal.

opportunities.title: APDA Social Science Research Grants
opportunities.description: NEW 2026 grant category. Sociology, psychology, public health approaches to PD. Less competitive than biomedical. Perfect for BCI accessibility/usability research.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Brand new category in 2026. Social science angle = less competition than biomedical.

opportunities.title: ALS Association Technology Development Grants
opportunities.description: Specifically funds assistive technologies and communication devices for ALS patients. BCIs are high priority. Less competitive than NIH equivalent.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Patient advocacy org with urgent need for BCI/communication tech. Direct path to clinical impact.

opportunities.title: JST ASPIRE International Collaboration
opportunities.description: Japan actively seeking US collaborators. US PI can lead if partnered with Japanese institution. Massive budgets. Rising Scientist track for early career.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Foreign funding most US researchers don't consider. Japan has surplus research budgets. Partnership model.

opportunities.title: Korea Brain Research Project
opportunities.description: Korea's brain initiative. Part of NSF Global Centers collaboration. American PIs can participate through bilateral agreements.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Korean government pushing international neurotech collaboration. K-Brain 2.0 initiative.

opportunities.title: Cryptocurrency Foundation Neurotech Investment
opportunities.description: Tether gave Blackrock Neurotech $200M in 2024. Crypto foundations actively seeking legitimate science investments for reputation. Direct pitch to foundations.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Crypto money looking for legitimacy. Massive capital. No traditional grant process - direct business development.

opportunities.title: ResearchHub Research Bounties
opportunities.description: Coinbase CEO's science platform. Post research questions, community funds answers. Earn crypto for peer review. Alternative funding for pilot studies.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Crypto-incentivized science. Fund small pilots before going for big grants.

opportunities.title: Georgia Phase 0 SBIR/STTR Support
opportunities.agency: University of Georgia / State of Georgia
opportunities.description: Free money for Georgia businesses applying for SBIR/STTR. Covers grant writing consultant. Use this BEFORE submitting federal applications.
opportunities.why_unconventional: State-level support most don't know about. Stack with federal applications.

opportunities.title: Tennessee SBIR Phase II Match
opportunities.description: Tennessee matches SBIR Phase II awards up to $300K. Double your federal money. Also offers free lab space.
opportunities.why_unconventional: State matching = double the money. Most don't apply for state matches.

opportunities.title: VA Parkinson's Disease Research Centers
opportunities.description: $16M dedicated to PD research in Nov 2025 funding bill. Less competitive than NIH. Veteran focus = unique patient population.
opportunities.why_unconventional: VA research is under-applied-to. Veteran angle for service-related exposures.

opportunities.title: Traumatic Brain Injury Research Program
opportunities.description: TBI is DOD priority. BCI for rehabilitation fits perfectly. Less competitive than NIH BRAIN Initiative.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Military medical research. Different review criteria than NIH. Rehabilitation focus.

opportunities.title: Wellcome Neuroscience Programmes
opportunities.description: UK's largest biomedical charity. Americans can apply. Focus on open science, mental health, neuroscience. Less US applicants = less competition.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Foreign foundation. US researchers eligible but rarely apply. £billions available.

opportunities.title: John Templeton Foundation Human Sciences
opportunities.description: Funds 'big questions' research. Consciousness, AI consciousness, human enhancement. BCI ethics angle. $3B endowment.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Philosophy + neuroscience crossover. Funds questions NIH won't touch. Huge endowment.

opportunities.title: W.M. Keck Foundation Research Program
opportunities.description: Funds 'high-risk, high-impact' research that federal agencies won't. Perfect for unconventional BCI approaches.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Explicitly funds what NIH considers too risky. Major private foundation.

opportunities.title: Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation Science
opportunities.description: Intel co-founder's foundation. Patient Care program funds technology for better healthcare. Data science crossovers.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Private foundation with different priorities than NIH. Technology-forward approach.

opportunities.title: Alfred P. Sloan Foundation Research Fellowships
opportunities.description: Prestigious early-career award. Unrestricted funds. Nomination required. Neuroscience is funded area.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Unrestricted funds. Prestige + flexibility. Less competitive than CAREER for some.

opportunities.title: Intel Labs Neuromorphic Research Partnerships
opportunities.description: Intel's neuromorphic computing lab. Loihi chips for brain-inspired computing. Hardware + funding for academic partners. $100M/year university investment.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Corporate research partnership. Access to cutting-edge hardware. Not a traditional grant.

opportunities.title: Microsoft Health Futures Research Partnerships
opportunities.description: Microsoft just partnered with INBRAIN Neuroelectronics for BCI+AI. Actively seeking health/neuro partners. Azure infrastructure included.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Corporate partnership. Cloud credits worth $100K+. AI infrastructure access.

opportunities.title: OpenAI Research Access Program
opportunities.description: Free API access for academic researchers. Not cash but significant compute value. AI+neuro intersection.
opportunities.why_unconventional: In-kind support. Compute credits = real money saved. Easy application.
requirements: AI safety or beneficial AI angle

opportunities.title: Gitcoin DeSci Grants
opportunities.description: Quadratic funding for science. Community matches donations. Open science projects get amplified funding.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Crypto crowdfunding with matching. Small donations become large through quadratic funding.

opportunities.title: Protocol Labs Research RFPs
opportunities.description: Filecoin creators. Retroactive Public Goods Funding model. Fund science that stores/shares data openly. $10M+ distributed.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Crypto-funded but legitimate research lab. Retroactive funding = get paid for completed work.

opportunities.title: Ethereum Foundation Ecosystem Support
opportunities.description: Ethereum funds academic research on decentralized systems. DeSci is priority area. Small grants (<$30K) fast-tracked.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Crypto foundation funding academic research. Fast process for small grants.

opportunities.title: IARPA Neuroscience Programs
opportunities.description: Intelligence community's DARPA. Brain/cognition research. BRAIN Initiative partner. Less known than DARPA but similar budgets.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Intelligence community funding. Different culture than NIH. Cognition/AI focus.

opportunities.title: Appalachian Regional Commission Innovation Grants
opportunities.description: North Georgia is Appalachian region. Innovation and technology grants for regional institutions. Less competitive.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Regional federal funding. North Georgia eligible. Economic development angle.

opportunities.title: Economic Development Administration Regional Innovation
opportunities.description: Tech-based economic development. Innovation hubs, startup ecosystems. Universities can partner.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Economic development funding for tech. Not traditional research grant structure.

opportunities.title: CDC National Center for Chronic Disease Prevention
opportunities.description: CDC funds assistive technology research through public health lens. Disability prevention focus. Less competitive than NIH.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Public health angle to neurotech. Different review criteria than NIH.

opportunities.title: Christopher & Dana Reeve Foundation Research Grants
opportunities.description: Spinal cord injury focus. BCIs for paralysis are priority. Quality of life research funded.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Patient advocacy funding. Direct clinical relevance. Paralysis = BCI target population.

opportunities.title: Craig H. Neilsen Foundation Research Grants
opportunities.description: Major SCI funder. Pilot grants and larger awards. Rehabilitation and assistive tech focus. Less competitive than federal.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Private foundation. SCI-focused. Funds what NIH considers too applied.

opportunities.title: Helmsley Charitable Trust Health Programs
opportunities.agency: Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust
opportunities.description: Major health funder. Rural health technology, healthcare access. $4B endowment. Invitation but accept inquiries.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Private foundation. Rural/access angle. Technology-forward health approach.

opportunities.title: Arnold Ventures Science Portfolio
opportunities.description: Funds research ON research. Reproducibility, open science, science reform. Methodology focus. Unconventional angle to any field.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Meta-research funding. Frame your work as improving research methodology.

opportunities.title: Simons Foundation Autism Research Initiative (SFARI)
opportunities.description: Massive autism research funder. BCIs for autism communication is emerging area. Explorer and Pilot awards for new ideas.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Autism angle for BCI communication research. Private foundation with billions.

opportunities.title: Schmidt Futures Science Programs
opportunities.description: Google CEO's philanthropy. AI for science is priority. Unconventional approaches welcomed. Fellows programs.
opportunities.why_unconventional: Tech billionaire philanthropy. AI-first approach to science funding.
